snippet: Many Yazidis who had fled the advance of ISIS militants have become separated from their families, some in their flight to the mountains, and some when they made the decision to come down.
abstract: Many families from Yazidi minority, who fled advance of Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants, have become separated, either in their flight to the Sinjar mountains or during their trek down; 20,000 to 30,000 people are believed to have entered Iraq from Syria at the Fishkhabour crossing.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: Many Yazidis who had fled the advance of ISIS militants have become separated from their families, some in their flight to the mountains, and some when they made the decision to come down.

headline.main: Scrambling Down an Iraqi Mountain, Yazidi Families Search for Missing
